page.title: 06 EMPLOYMENT
page.content: On Sark there are a wide variety of jobs such as farming, fishing and gardening. There is a quarry and 100 metres further down the harbour hill is Maseline harbour, the most modern of the two harbours. On the harbour's quay tractors wait three times a week in summer and twice in the winter for the Sark Trader, carrying the island's supplies, from Guernsey. These include food, building supplies, newspapers, the post and, when needed, cattle food. These are brought up the hill by the carters, the local term for delivery man. The two postmen who deliver and sort the mail,and the telephone exchange enginer are all payed from the Guernsey.Three teachers are employed, one infant, one junior and one senior who doubles as head.
